## Summary

Our team examined data from the Stanford Education Data Archive (SEDA) to answer two questions:

 - To what extent were racial academic achievement gaps of students grades [K-12] in the United States impacted by their schoolâ€™s response to COVID-19?
 - How does the gap in test-based achievement between years pre- and post-COVID pandemic vary between different states and why?

Through data analysis, we concluded that Black and Hispanic children faced significant drops in test scores due to increased impact of poverty and access to resources. Across different states, the pandemic affected test scores for children in more impoverished states, regardless of race.
